Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• Repeat violations.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4506 Fire Drills and Telephone
Section (1) There shall be quarterly emergency fire drills for each staff
Description shift. Two of the drills shall include evacuations, unless approved
by the department, in writing, as clinically contraindicated. Where
a facility has a 24-hour staff shift, the emergency drills shall be
conducted at different times of the day and night. Written records
shall be maintained for each drill indicating the date and time of
1

the drill and, where evacuation was a part of the drill, the
approximate evacuation time.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Facility did not complete fire drills for quarter of April-May-June
2023.
Investigation Administrator 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility, on
7/10/2023. This interview took place during an unannounced
quarterly visit. During this visit, Administrator 2 provided the
logbook for emergency drills at the facility. When examining the
logbook, it was discovered that there were no emergency drills
documented as having occurred during the second quarter (April,
May, and June) of 2023. Administrator 2 checked the logbook and
agreed that the drills had not been completed as required.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility, on
7/11/2023. When presenting with the information about the
missing fire drills, she reported believing that they had not been
done or they would have been documented.
Document Reviewed:
Emergency Drill logs 2023. This document outlines the times
and days the drills took place. The face sheet has the dates of the
drills by quarter and behind the face sheet is the individual sheets
outlines specific information about the drill. The specific
information includes the shift, time, and results of the drills. Not
only was the documentation missing on the face sheet but the
individual sheets for the quarter were also missing.
Emergency Fires Policy dated 10/12/2020. This policy
documents in the prevention section, the facility will conduct fire
drills every 30-days on alternating shifts and at least one fire drill
must be completed on every shift every 90-days.
Analysis Based upon interviews and written documentation, evidence
supports the facility failed to follow their own policy and the rule for
quarterly drills.
Conclusion Violation Established
2

With an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no change be
made to the license of this child caring institution.
